channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Igor Kirillov: Russia's chemical weapons chief and mouthpiece killed in Moscow
item.description: Kirillov, who has been killed in Moscow, was accused by the West of overseeing the use of chemical weapons on the battlefield in Ukraine.

item.title: Judge rejects Trump’s bid to toss hush money conviction because of Supreme Court immunity ruling
Here's what to know as electors cast ballots in 2024 election
item.description: Electors are voting in each state to formalize President-elect Donald Trump's victory over Vice President Kamala Harris in the 2024 election.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire talks in final stage, Palestinian negotiator tells BBC
item.description: The official outlines a phased plan which would see hostages freed in step with Israeli pullouts.

item.title: General killed in Moscow a legitimate target, says Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian sources tell the BBC the country's security service was behind the killings.

item.title: Argentinian President Javier Milei likely to attend Trump inauguration
item.description: Milei is the first world leader expected to be in Washington, D.C. for President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration, though arrangements are underway f...

item.title: Here's what we know about the deadly school shooting in Madison, Wisconsin
item.description: The suspect is likely to have died from a gunshot wound, but the cause of death has yet to be confirmed by a medical examiner.

item.title: Ukraine claims it's behind Moscow blast that killed head of Russia's nuclear defense forces
item.description: The head of Russia's nuclear defense forces, Lt. General Igor Kirillov, was killed along with his deputy in an explosion in Moscow, Russian investigat...

item.title: 'Fake electors' from 2020 are casting 2024 votes for Trump while facing felony charges
item.description: Eight of the Republicans set to cast Michigan and Nevada's 2024 Electoral College votes for President-elect Donald Trump still face felony charges rel...

item.title: FBI warns Americans to keep their text messages secure: What to know
item.description: The U.S. believes hackers affiliated with China's government are infiltrating telecoms and stealing users' data. The FBI has urged people to use end-t...

item.title: Trump meets TikTok CEO as ban deadline looms
item.description: The social media giant is currently seeking to delay a law that would see it banned or sold in early 2025.

item.title: Things to know about the shooting at a Christian school in Wisconsin
"Star Trek II," "Dirty Dancing" among films named to National Film Registry
item.description: Among the 25 films selected by the Library of Congress to be preserved for future generations are the Coen Brothers' "No Country for Old Men," "The So...

item.title: A transplanted pig kidney offers a grandmother hope for life without dialysis
item.description: The patient was in kidney failure and her immune system would reject a human organ. Scientists hope genetically modified pig organs prove safe and wil...

item.title: Quake rocks Pacific island Vanuatu, deaths feared, U.S. embassy damaged
item.description: A powerful earthquake hit the Pacific island nation of Vanuatu, damaging buildings in the capital, Port Vila, including one housing the U.S. Embassy. ...

item.title: Two killed by female student in shooting at US Christian school
item.description: Police have identified the suspect, who is also among the dead, as a 15-year-old female student.

item.title: Apprenticeships are a trending alternative to college — but there's a hitch
item.description: Apprenticeships are becoming a popular alternative to college as a career path. But demand is outpacing the supply of employers who offer them.

item.title: 15-year-old girl fatally shoots teacher and teenager at a Christian school in Wisconsin
item.description: Police say a 15-year-old student opened fire inside a study hall at a small Christian school in Wisconsin, killing a teacher and teenager.
